case_title: Raja Muhammad Akram vs Chief Secretary, Government of Baluchistan

charges: Failure to perceive tension in the area during bye-election.
Inadequate security arrangements at polling stations.
Failure to shift polling station despite requests.
Neglect in visiting polling stations on election day.
Allowing armed persons within polling station limits.

initial_inquiry.findings: None of the charges were proved against the appellant.

government_action.initial_recommendation: Minor penalties proposed by Chief Secretary Sheikh Jamil Ahmad.
government_action.subsequent_action: Dismissal from service by successor Chief Secretary.

legal_analysis.rule_violation: Proceedings under Rule 5(2) and Rule 5(3) cannot be initiated simultaneously.
legal_analysis.evidence_review: Inquiry Officer's findings were based on evidence; no direct or circumstantial evidence against the appellant was presented.

final_decision.appeal_outcome: Impugned order dated 19th July, 1983 set aside.
final_decision.reinstatement: Appellant reinstated with all benefits accrued under the law.

legal_references: Baluchistan Civil Servants (Efficiency and Discipline) Rules, 1974
